alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Western Hanover; Western King William (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 9:03PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern King and Queen, Caroline, north central Hanover, northern King William and northwestern Essex Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 903 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kings Dominion, or 9 miles north of Randolph Macon College, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern King and Queen, Caroline, north central Hanover, northern King William and northwestern Essex Counties, including the following locations... Sparta, Golansville, Oliver, Gum Tree, Coatesville, Central Point, Hewlett, Doswell, Penola, and Noel. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Caroline; Western Hanover; Western King William
